security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown text. Static findings are false positives caused by markdown code block syntax (backticks) and documentation examples being misidentified as executable code patterns. No network, filesystem, or command execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: AI responses often miss the mark due to vague or incomplete prompts. This skill provides structured frameworks, proven techniques, and templates for crafting clear, specific prompts that get the results you want.
actual_capabilities: Provide structured prompt frameworks (Role, Context, Task, Format)
Explain prompting techniques (Zero-Shot, Few-Shot, Chain-of-Thought, Role Prompting)
Offer anti-patterns to avoid when writing prompts
limitations: Does not execute code or interact with external APIs
Cannot access files or system resources
Provides guidance only, no automated prompt generation
Does not integrate with specific platform features

use_cases.title: Write Effective Code Prompts
use_cases.description: Structure technical requests with environment details, constraints, and clear goals.

use_cases.title: Create Consistent AI Content
use_cases.description: Use role prompting and format specifications for reliable, styled output.

use_cases.title: Design System Prompts
use_cases.description: Build reusable templates that guide AI behavior for consistent workflows.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Structure
prompt_templates.prompt:
## Role
[Define AI role]

## Context
[Background and constraints]

## Task
[Specific request]

## Format
[Desired output format]

prompt_templates.title: Code Request
prompt_templates.prompt:
## Environment
- Language: [language]
- Framework: [framework]
- Version: [version]

## Current State
[Current code]

## Goal
[Desired outcome]

## Constraints
- [Constraint 1]
- [Constraint 2]

prompt_templates.title: Chain-of-Thought
prompt_templates.prompt:
Think through this step by step:
1. First, analyze the problem...
2. List possible solutions...
3. Evaluate each option...
4. Select the best solution...

prompt_templates.title: System Prompt
prompt_templates.prompt:
# Identity
[AI purpose and role]

# Capabilities
- [Capability 1]
- [Capability 2]

# Constraints
- [Limit 1]
- [Limit 2]

# Response Format
[Formatting rules]

output_examples.input: Help me write a function to sort users by registration date
output: Specify language (Python), data structure (User objects with registration_date field)
Mention sort order (newest first) and output format with comments
Include error handling and edge cases like empty list or duplicate dates

output_examples.input: Review my API error handling code
output: Define role as senior developer with security focus
Provide context about framework (Express.js) and error types
Specify review constraints like OWASP guidelines to follow

best_practices: Be specific about environment, constraints, and expected output format
Use the Role-Context-Task-Format structure for complex requests
Provide examples when seeking a particular style or format
anti_patterns: Vague requests like 'fix my code' without specifying the error or goal
Overloading prompts with irrelevant information that obscures the core request
Negative instructions ('do not use X') instead of positive guidance ('use Y')

faq.question: Which AI tools support these prompting techniques?
faq.answer: These techniques work with all major AI assistants including Claude, ChatGPT, Gemini, and Codex.

faq.question: How long can my prompts be?
faq.answer: Most platforms support prompts up to several thousand tokens. Complex requests benefit from detail but stay focused.

faq.question: Can I combine multiple techniques?
faq.answer: Yes. Combining techniques like role prompting with chain-of-thought often produces better results.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these prompts?
faq.answer: This skill contains only guidance text. No data is sent anywhere. Your prompts remain private to your AI service.

faq.question: Why does my prompt sometimes fail?
faq.answer: Common issues include missing context, conflicting constraints, or unclear success criteria. Use the framework structure.

faq.question: How is this different from system prompts?
faq.answer: System prompts set permanent AI behavior. User prompts are single requests. This skill covers both approaches.
